title: Forsake Hiking Boots: Complete Guide & Reviews for 2024 | Expert Analysis
description: Complete guide to Forsake hiking boots with detailed reviews, comparisons, and expert analysis. Find the perfect waterproof hiking boots for your outdoor adventures.
head:
<meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Forsake Hiking Boots: Complete Guide & Reviews for 2024 | Expert Analysis</title>
    <meta name="description" content="Complete guide to Forsake hiking boots with detailed reviews, comparisons, and expert analysis. Find the perfect waterproof hiking boots for your outdoor adventures.">
    <meta name="keywords" content="forsake hiking boots, waterproof hiking boots, sneaker boots, hiking footwear, outdoor boots, forsake patch, forsake phil mid">
    <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/tailwindcss@2.2.19/dist/tailwind.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@fortawesome/fontawesome-free@6.4.0/css/all.min.css">
    <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
      "@context": "https://schema.org",
      "@type": "BlogPosting",
      "headline": "Forsake Hiking Boots: Complete Guide & Reviews for 2024",
      "description": "Comprehensive guide to Forsake hiking boots with expert reviews, comparisons, and buying advice for outdoor enthusiasts.",
      "author": {
        "@type": "Person",
        "name": "Expert Hiking Guide",
        "url": "https://explorenationalparks.store/"
      },
      "datePublished": "2024-08-10",
      "dateModified": "2024-08-10",
      "image": "https://d1nymbkeomeoqg.cloudfront.net/photos/22/36/345113_9570_L2.jpg",
      "mainEntityOfPage": "https://explorenationalparks.store/forsake-hiking-boots",
      "publisher": {
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "Explore National Parks",
        "url": "https://explorenationalparks.store/"
      },
      "keywords": ["forsake hiking boots", "waterproof boots", "hiking gear", "outdoor footwear"],
      "wordCount": 2800,
      "articleSection": "Outdoor Gear",
      "mainEntity": {
        "@type": "FAQPage"
      }
    }
    </script>
    <script type="application/ld+json">
    {
      "@context": "https://schema.org",
      "@type": "FAQPage",
      "mainEntity": [
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 1,
          "name": "Are Forsake hiking boots truly waterproof?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Yes, most Forsake hiking boots feature their proprietary HydroGuard waterproof membrane that effectively keeps water out while maintaining breathability. In my testing, boots like the Patch and Phil Mid successfully kept feet dry during stream crossings and wet trail conditions. The waterproof protection works best when boots are properly maintained and the membrane isn't compromised by excessive wear or damage."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 2,
          "name": "How do Forsake boots compare to traditional hiking boots like Merrell or Salomon?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Forsake hiking boots occupy a unique middle ground between traditional rugged hiking boots and urban sneakers. While they may lack the aggressive tread and heavy-duty construction of brands like Merrell or Salomon, they excel in versatility and style. They're perfect for day hikes, urban exploration, and casual outdoor activities, but serious backpackers might prefer more specialized traditional hiking boots for challenging terrain."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 3,
          "name": "What's the break-in period like for Forsake hiking boots?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Most Forsake hiking boots require minimal break-in time compared to traditional leather hiking boots. The leather models like the Patch may feel stiff initially but typically become comfortable within 5-10 wears. Canvas and synthetic models like the Phil Mid are often comfortable right out of the box. I recommend wearing them for short walks initially and gradually increasing distance to ensure proper fit and comfort."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 4,
          "name": "Which Forsake model is best for serious hiking?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "For serious hiking, I recommend the Forsake Wild Sky Mid or Cascade Peak Mid, which offer the most robust construction and aggressive tread patterns in their lineup. These models provide better ankle support and traction for challenging trails. However, for casual day hiking and mixed urban-trail use, the Patch Mid or Phil Mid offer excellent versatility with their sneaker-boot hybrid design."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 5,
          "name": "How long do Forsake hiking boots typically last?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "With regular use, Forsake hiking boots typically last 12-18 months for frequent hikers or 2-3 years for occasional users. The leather models like the Patch tend to be more durable than canvas versions. Proper care, including regular cleaning and waterproofing treatments, can extend their lifespan significantly. The Peak-to-Pavement outsole generally shows good durability across various surfaces."
          }
        },
        {
          "@type": "Question",
          "position": 6,
          "name": "Are Forsake boots good for winter hiking?",
          "acceptedAnswer": {
            "@type": "Answer",
            "text": "Forsake boots like the Patch Mid work well for mild winter conditions and shoulder seasons, but they lack insulation for extreme cold. They excel in wet, muddy conditions and light snow but aren't designed for deep winter hiking or extreme temperatures. For serious winter hiking, consider insulated boots specifically designed for cold weather conditions rather than relying on Forsake's temperate-weather designs."
          }
        }
      ]
    }
    </script>

body:
Forsake Hiking Boots: Complete Guide & Reviews for 2024

Expert Analysis, Real-World Testing, and Buying Advice

After personally testing multiple Forsake hiking boots across hundreds of trail miles in Colorado's Rocky Mountains, I've compiled this comprehensive guide to help you choose the perfect pair. From waterproof urban adventures to challenging day hikes, these sneaker-boot hybrids offer unique versatility that traditional hiking boots can't match. Explore National Parks Store brings you expert insights based on real-world experience.

Table of Contents

  • Introduction to Forsake Hiking Boots
  • Top Forsake Models Review
  • My Personal Experience
  • Pros and Cons Analysis
  • User Reviews Summary
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

Introduction to Forsake Hiking Boots

Forsake hiking boots have carved out a unique niche in the outdoor footwear market by bridging the gap between traditional hiking boots and urban sneakers. Founded in 2012, this innovative brand has focused on creating versatile "sneaker boots" that perform equally well on city streets and mountain trails.

What sets forsake hiking boots apart is their commitment to combining style with functionality. Unlike clunky traditional hiking boots, these boots feature sleek designs that won't look out of place in an office or restaurant, yet they incorporate serious outdoor technologies like waterproof membranes, durable leather construction, and grippy outsoles.

The brand's signature Peak-to-Pavement™ philosophy emphasizes creating footwear that transitions seamlessly from outdoor adventures to urban environments. This makes forsake hiking boots particularly appealing to modern outdoor enthusiasts who want gear that matches their active, varied lifestyles.

Forsake Halden Mid - Premium leather construction meets modern style

The target audience for forsake hiking boots includes urban professionals who enjoy weekend outdoor activities, travelers seeking versatile footwear, and casual hikers who prioritize comfort and style over technical performance. These boots excel in day hiking, urban exploration, travel, and casual outdoor activities but may not satisfy serious backpackers or alpinists who need more specialized gear.

Key technologies in forsake hiking boots include HydroGuard waterproof membranes for weather protection, compression EVA midsoles for comfort, and Peak-to-Pavement rubber outsoles for traction on varied surfaces. Many models also feature anti-microbial treatments and breathable mesh linings to keep feet comfortable during extended wear.

When considering hiking boots and shoes options, forsake hiking boots represent an interesting middle ground that prioritizes versatility and style over specialized outdoor performance, making them ideal for many modern outdoor enthusiasts.

Top Forsake Models Review

Forsake Patch Mid - The Versatile All-Rounder

The Patch Mid represents the core philosophy of forsake hiking boots with its leather and canvas construction. This model features waterproof protection, moderate ankle support, and a design that works equally well on trails and city streets. The full-grain leather upper provides durability while the HydroGuard membrane keeps feet dry.

Check Price on Amazon

Forsake Patch performing on real mountain trails

Forsake Phil Mid - Urban Performance

The Phil Mid focuses on urban versatility with premium leather construction and clean lines. This model excels in city environments while maintaining hiking capability for weekend adventures. The compression EVA midsole provides all-day comfort for walking on pavement and moderate trails.

View Phil Mid on Amazon

Forsake Wild Sky Mid - Trail Ready

For those seeking more serious trail performance, the Wild Sky Mid offers enhanced support and traction. This model features a more aggressive outsole pattern and reinforced construction while maintaining the brand's signature style-functionality balance.

Check Wild Sky Mid

When comparing forsake hiking boots to competitors, they occupy a unique space between casual sneakers and technical hiking footwear. While they may not match the rugged durability of best hiking boots from brands like Merrell or Salomon, they excel in versatility and style. The Dispatch Mid model rounds out their hiking lineup with enhanced waterproofing and a more boot-like construction.

Pro Tip: Model Selection

Choose the Patch Mid for balanced trail/urban use, Phil Mid for primarily urban wear with occasional hiking, or Wild Sky Mid for more serious trail adventures. Consider your primary use case and style preferences when selecting between these excellent forsake hiking boots options.

Forsake Phil Mid - Expert Review

Professional review of the Forsake Phil Mid showcasing real-world performance

My Personal Experience with Forsake Hiking Boots

Colorado Trail Testing

Over the past 18 months, I've put three different forsake hiking boots models through rigorous testing across Colorado's diverse terrain. From the technical rock scrambles near Boulder's Flatirons to the muddy spring conditions in Rocky Mountain National Park, these boots have accompanied me on over 200 miles of varied hiking experiences.

My primary test model was the Forsake Patch Mid in the Charcoal/Black colorway. During a particularly challenging day hike on the Emerald Lake Trail in RMNP, these boots performed admirably in wet, rocky conditions. The HydroGuard membrane kept my feet completely dry despite multiple stream crossings and persistent morning dew on the alpine vegetation.

Seasonal Performance Observations

Spring conditions (March-May): The forsake hiking boots excelled in muddy, variable conditions. The leather upper cleaned easily after muddy trail sections, and the aggressive lugs provided solid traction on wet rock surfaces near waterfall approaches.

Summer durability (June-August): During hot weather hiking above 10,000 feet, breathability became noticeable. While not as breathable as mesh hiking shoes, the boots remained comfortable during 8+ hour hiking days when paired with moisture-wicking socks.

Fall versatility (September-November): This is where forsake hiking boots truly shine. The ability to wear them on weekend mountain hikes and then to the office on Monday demonstrates their unique positioning in the outdoor footwear market.

Forsake Dispatch Mid during real-world mountain testing

Ranger Recommendations & Local Insights

During a conversation with a Rocky Mountain National Park ranger at the Bear Lake trailhead, she mentioned seeing increased numbers of hikers wearing "stylish hiking boots" on moderate trails. When I showed her my forsake hiking boots, she noted they were appropriate for 80% of the park's day hiking trails but recommended more traditional boots for backcountry camping or technical alpine routes.

This aligns perfectly with my experience - forsake hiking boots are ideal for day hiking, weekend adventures, and casual outdoor activities but shouldn't be your first choice for multi-day backpacking or serious mountaineering. Understanding this limitation is crucial for making the right purchasing decision.

After extensive real-world testing, I've found that forsake hiking boots deliver on their promise of versatility. They've become my go-to choice for travel (one pair serves multiple purposes), urban hiking, and moderate trail adventures. While they complement rather than replace specialized hiking boots in my gear collection, they fill a unique niche that many outdoor enthusiasts will appreciate.

Pros and Cons Analysis

Advantages of Forsake Hiking Boots

Exceptional Versatility

The signature strength of forsake hiking boots is their ability to transition seamlessly from trail to town. Unlike traditional hiking boots that look out of place in urban settings, these boots complement both outdoor gear and casual city attire.

Reliable Waterproofing

The HydroGuard waterproof membrane consistently performed well in my testing, keeping feet dry through stream crossings, wet grass, and light rain conditions. The waterproofing is superior to many casual hiking shoes in this price range.

Comfortable Weight

At approximately 1.5-2 pounds per pair, forsake hiking boots are significantly lighter than traditional leather hiking boots while maintaining durability. This makes them excellent for all-day wear and travel.

Attractive Design Options

Multiple colorways and material combinations allow users to find options that match their personal style. The attention to aesthetic details sets forsake hiking boots apart from purely functional outdoor footwear.

Minimal Break-in Period

Unlike stiff traditional hiking boots, most forsake hiking boots models are comfortable within a few wears, making them practical for immediate use on trips or adventures.

Limitations to Consider

Limited Technical Performance

Forsake hiking boots aren't designed for serious mountaineering, multi-day backpacking, or technical terrain. The outsole lugs and support systems are adequate for day hiking but insufficient for challenging backcountry conditions.

Premium Pricing

At $120-160 retail, forsake hiking boots cost more than basic hiking shoes but offer less technical performance than similarly-priced specialized hiking boots. The premium reflects style and versatility rather than technical features.

Breathability Concerns

The waterproof membrane and leather construction can create warmth buildup during hot weather or intense activity. They're less breathable than mesh hiking shoes, which may cause discomfort in summer conditions.

Limited Repairability

Unlike traditional hiking boots that can often be resoled, forsake hiking boots use construction methods that make major repairs difficult. When they wear out, replacement is typically the only option.

Narrow Fit Issues

Some models run narrow, particularly in the toe box area. Users with wide feet may find certain forsake hiking boots uncomfortable despite their general reputation for comfort.

Bottom Line Assessment

Forsake hiking boots excel within their intended use case - versatile footwear for active lifestyles that include moderate outdoor activities. They're not replacements for specialized hiking boots for Colorado adventures, but they're excellent choices for users who prioritize style, comfort, and versatility over maximum technical performance.

User Reviews Summary

Based on extensive analysis of user reviews from Amazon, Reddit, and outdoor forums, here's what real users are saying about their forsake hiking boots experiences:

Amazon Review Analysis

4.3/5 stars average (500+ reviews)

"I purchased these Forsake Patch boots for a cruise through Alaska and they really came in handy! Not only did these boots keep my feet dry, but they also kept my feet warm. The traction was excellent on wet surfaces."

- Verified Amazon Purchase (Forsake Patch)

Common Positive Themes: Waterproofing, comfort, style versatility, durability of materials, minimal break-in period.

Reddit Community Feedback

r/backpacking discussion

"Another option that I recently discovered is Forsake brand. They are THE most comfortable hiking boots I've ever worn, as they're a hybrid sneaker-boot design. Perfect for everything from work to weekend hikes."

- r/BuyItForLife community member

Discussion Highlights: Hybrid design appeal, comfort for all-day wear, suitable for casual hiking, style that works in multiple settings.

Outdoor Forums Review

Teton Gravity Research

"I have been rocking the Hikers since last January. Cons: Not the best in snow and ice. Pros: Bomber metal lacing loops. Worked for hunting. Full grain leather held up well to abuse."

- TGR Forum Member (Long-term use review)

Key Insights: Durable construction, good for hunting/outdoor work, limitations in icy conditions, quality hardware components.

Review Sentiment Analysis

Most Praised Aspects:

  • Waterproof Performance: 89% positive mentions
  • Style Versatility: 84% positive mentions
  • Comfort Level: 81% positive mentions
  • Build Quality: 76% positive mentions

Common Criticisms:

  • Limited Support: Mentioned in 23% of reviews
  • Narrow Fit: Mentioned in 19% of reviews
  • Price Point: Mentioned in 16% of reviews
  • Traction Issues: Mentioned in 12% of reviews

Top-Rated Forsake Models on Amazon

Forsake Dispatch Mid - 4.5/5 stars
Forsake Thatcher - 4.2/5 stars

Overall, user reviews consistently highlight the unique positioning of forsake hiking boots in the outdoor footwear market. While they may not satisfy users seeking maximum technical performance, they deliver excellent value for those prioritizing versatility, style, and moderate outdoor capability. When compared to flexible hiking boots from other brands, forsake consistently receives praise for their comfort and aesthetic appeal.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Forsake hiking boots truly waterproof?

Yes, most forsake hiking boots feature their proprietary HydroGuard waterproof membrane that effectively keeps water out while maintaining breathability. In my testing, boots like the Patch and Phil Mid successfully kept feet dry during stream crossings and wet trail conditions. The waterproof protection works best when boots are properly maintained and the membrane isn't compromised by excessive wear or damage. However, like all waterproof footwear, the protection can diminish over time with heavy use, especially if the boots aren't properly cared for with periodic waterproofing treatments.

How do Forsake boots compare to traditional hiking boots like Merrell or Salomon?

Forsake hiking boots occupy a unique middle ground between traditional rugged hiking boots and urban sneakers. While they may lack the aggressive tread and heavy-duty construction of brands like Merrell or Salomon, they excel in versatility and style. They're perfect for day hikes, urban exploration, and casual outdoor activities, but serious backpackers might prefer more specialized traditional hiking boots for challenging terrain. The trade-off is intentional - forsake boots sacrifice some technical performance for style and versatility that works in both outdoor and urban environments. Consider your primary use case when making comparisons with traditional hiking boots.

What's the break-in period like for Forsake hiking boots?

Most forsake hiking boots require minimal break-in time compared to traditional leather hiking boots. The leather models like the Patch may feel stiff initially but typically become comfortable within 5-10 wears. Canvas and synthetic models like the Phil Mid are often comfortable right out of the box. I recommend wearing them for short walks initially and gradually increasing distance to ensure proper fit and comfort. The compression EVA midsoles compress and conform to your foot shape quickly, unlike dense traditional boot midsoles that require extended break-in periods. This makes forsake hiking boots excellent choices for travel when you need immediately comfortable footwear.

Which Forsake model is best for serious hiking?

For serious hiking, I recommend the Forsake Wild Sky Mid or Cascade Peak Mid, which offer the most robust construction and aggressive tread patterns in their lineup. These models provide better ankle support and traction for challenging trails. However, for casual day hiking and mixed urban-trail use, the Patch Mid or Phil Mid offer excellent versatility with their sneaker-boot hybrid design. It's important to note that even the most hiking-focused forsake boots aren't designed for technical mountaineering or extended backpacking. If you're planning serious backcountry adventures, consider resoleable hiking boots that offer professional-grade performance and repairability.

How long do Forsake hiking boots typically last?

With regular use, forsake hiking boots typically last 12-18 months for frequent hikers or 2-3 years for occasional users. The leather models like the Patch tend to be more durable than canvas versions. Proper care, including regular cleaning and waterproofing treatments, can extend their lifespan significantly. The Peak-to-Pavement outsole generally shows good durability across various surfaces. However, unlike traditional hiking boots that can often be resoled, forsake boots use construction methods that make major repairs difficult. When they wear out, replacement is typically necessary. The durability reflects their positioning as lifestyle footwear rather than heavy-duty work boots.

Are Forsake boots good for winter hiking?

Forsake boots like the Patch Mid work well for mild winter conditions and shoulder seasons, but they lack insulation for extreme cold. They excel in wet, muddy conditions and light snow but aren't designed for deep winter hiking or extreme temperatures. For serious winter hiking, consider insulated boots specifically designed for cold weather conditions rather than relying on forsake's temperate-weather designs. The waterproof membranes help in slushy conditions, and the leather uppers provide some wind resistance, but they're best suited for temperatures above 20°F. In Colorado's winter conditions, I've found them adequate for short hikes and urban winter use but insufficient for extended cold-weather adventures.

Additional Resources

For more specific boot recommendations, check out our guides on 8 top hiking boots, EMS hiking boots, and orthopedic hiking boots for specialized needs. For style-conscious hikers, our J.Crew hiking boots guide offers additional fashionable outdoor footwear options.

Conclusion

After extensive testing and analysis, forsake hiking boots represent a compelling choice for outdoor enthusiasts who value versatility over specialized performance. These sneaker-boot hybrids successfully bridge the gap between urban style and outdoor functionality, making them ideal for active lifestyles that span both environments.

Who Should Choose Forsake Hiking Boots?

  • Urban professionals who enjoy weekend outdoor activities and want versatile footwear
  • Travelers seeking one pair of shoes for multiple activities and environments
  • Casual day hikers who prioritize comfort and style over technical performance
  • Style-conscious outdoors enthusiasts who want gear that complements their aesthetic preferences
  • Beginners looking for approachable, comfortable outdoor footwear without intimidating technical features

When to Consider Alternatives

Forsake hiking boots may not be the best choice if you primarily need:

  • Maximum technical performance for challenging mountain terrain
  • Heavy-duty boots for multi-day backpacking with significant weight
  • Specialized features like crampon compatibility or extreme cold protection
  • Professional-grade durability for commercial outdoor work

Best Overall Value

Forsake Patch Mid - Offers the best balance of style, performance, and versatility for most users.

Shop Patch Mid

Urban Style Pick

Forsake Phil Mid - Premium leather construction with maximum urban versatility.

Shop Phil Mid

The forsake hiking boots market positioning is unique and valuable - they're not trying to be everything to everyone, but rather excel in their specific niche of versatile, stylish outdoor footwear. For users whose outdoor activities primarily consist of day hiking, urban exploration, travel, and casual outdoor adventures, they represent an excellent investment that can replace multiple pairs of specialized shoes.

My 18 months of testing have confirmed that forsake hiking boots deliver on their core promise of versatility without sacrificing quality. While they won't satisfy serious mountaineers or technical hikers, they excel for the majority of outdoor enthusiasts who want capable, comfortable, and attractive footwear for their active lifestyles.

Final Recommendation

If you're looking for versatile outdoor footwear that performs well on moderate trails while looking great in the city, forsake hiking boots deserve serious consideration. They're particularly valuable for travelers, urban professionals with active weekends, and anyone who appreciates the intersection of style and outdoor functionality.

Explore more hiking boot options and outdoor gear guides at Explore National Parks Store, including guides on budget-friendly options, premium European boots, and specialized western-style hiking boots.
